newsitem.title: CHINA: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - July 10.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - July 10.

text.p: Following is a summary of major Chinese political and business stories in leading newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Beijing. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not guarantee their accuracy. Telephone: (8610) 6532-1921. Fax: (8610) 6532-4978.
PEOPLE'S DAILY
- China registers steady industrial growth during the first half with industrial sectors above township-level generating 984.9 billion yuan, up 11.6 percent year-on-year when adjusted for inflation.
- President Jiang Zemin tells former Japanese Prime Minister Tsutomu Hata that Japan can only pursue peaceful development if it can correctly recall its role in history.
- Shenzhen tax bureau withdraws a Sino-Japanese joint venture's right to use 2.0 million square metres of land after it tried to evade 120 million yuan of tax.
- Summer grain output in Xinjiang reaches 4.47 million tonnes, 100,000 tonnes more than last year.
XINHUA DAILY TELEGRAPH
- Premier Li Peng says Sino-Japanese relations will develop in a healthy and stable manner if the joint communique and peace treaty signed by the two counties are strictly observed.
- Premier Li Peng tells Supreme Head of State of Malaysia Tunku Ja'afar their frequent exchanges of visits have given a constant impetus to relations.
FINANCIAL NEWS
- People's Insurance Company of China pays 30 million yuan compensation to Beijing Dongfang Chemical Plant for fire damage.
- Vice-Governor of the Central Bank Chen Yuan says China's banking sector needs to improve its payments system.
- The State Administration of Foreign Exchange issues foreign exchange license to the North China Power Group Finance Co Ltd.
- Exports of silk products in the first quarter earn $538 million, up 17.55 percent year-on-year.
CHINA SECURITIES
- The Shanghai and Shenzhen stock exchanges ask listed firms to strictly follow official rules when issuing interim reports.
- China sets up a Qingdao Brewery Group with registered capital from state-owned shares in the Tsingtao Brewery Co Ltd.
INTERNATIONAL BUSINESS DAILY
- Ministry of Foreign Trade and Economic Cooperation says China to give more foreign donated funds to central and western regions.
ECONOMIC DAILY
- Editorial calls for mergers of small and inefficient cigarette makers.
- Unsold residential space in China reaches 66.24 million square metres by end of 1996, up nearly 30 percent from the previous year.
CHINA BUSINESS DAILY
- Retail sales in Beijing hit 50.08 billion yuan in first half, up by inflation-adjusted 7.5 percent year-on-year.
CHINA DAILY
- A symposium on establishing a legal system for the socialist market economy says China's economy needs more laws, but they must be consistent and more practicable.
- China will stand by its decision to open the commercial sector to foreign investors, despite the competition they are expected to give to struggling state-owned businesses.
- Production of onshore oil and gas has risen steadily this year with intensified exploitation of China's western oil and gas fields.
- Ministry of Coal Industry says upgraded technology and market competition are expected to help the money-losing coal industry show a profit by the end of this year.
